thread.title: Chefs Leah Chase and John Folse Will Reign Over Krewe of Lafcadio Parade
thread.title_full: Chefs Leah Chase and John Folse Will Reign Over Krewe of Lafcadio Parade

author: Brenna Houck
title: Chefs Leah Chase and John Folse Will Reign Over Krewe of Lafcadio Parade
text: Chefs Leah Chase and John Folse Will Reign Over Krewe of Lafcadio Parade The march celebrates New Orleans culinary culture Leah Chase. Photo by Sean Gardner/Getty Images ICONS — Renowned chefs Leah Chase of Dooky Chase’s Restaurant and chef/author John Folse will reign over the Krewe of Lafcadio’s marching parade — a celebration of New Orleans culinary heritage — on February 25 in the French Quarter. The march begins at 2 p.m. at Antoine’s Restaurant. [The Advocate] BEER HERE — As Eater recently reported , a number of new breweries are headed to New Orleans this year. Draft Magazine rounds up five of the major players in a recent article. [Draft] NEWS — A reef rebuilding program that utilized area restaurants’ discarded oyster shells on Louisiana’s coast may be in jeopardy. While it was initially the fastest growing program, a grant that helped fund the collection recently expired, leaving restaurants stuck paying half the cost of $150 per collection bin. Approximately 26 participating restaurants have left the program recently. [AP via ABC] Tipping is essential. Have a hot piece of restaurant intel you’re dying to share? Send it to the Eater New Orleans tipline and we’ll check it out.
